         MARKING NOTES
   REMARQUES POUR LA NOTATION
    NOTAS PARA LA CORRECCIÓN


  November / novembre / noviembre 2013

         ENGLISH / ANGLAIS / INGLÉS A:
          LITERATURE / LITTÉRATURE /
                 LITERATURA

                        Higher Level
                      Niveau Supérieur
                       Nivel Superior

                  Paper / Épreuve / Prueba 2




6 pages/páginas
                              –2–         N13/1/AXENG/HP2/ENG/TZ0/XX/M




These marking notes are confidential and for the exclusive use of
examiners in this examination session.

They are the property of the International Baccalaureate and
must not be reproduced or distributed to any other person
without the authorization of the IB Assessment Centre.
                                               –3–           N13/1/AXENG/HP2/ENG/TZ0/XX/M


Examiners: please note that the term “comparison”, both in the descriptors and in the
marking notes, includes the discussion of relevant “contrasts” as well.

The features of the “very good to excellent” answers assume that those for “adequate to good”
are included.

Drama

1.   An adequate to good answer will identify situations where props are significant and discuss
     the ways in which props, for example, sharpen focus, reinforce ideas or generate an emotional
     response. It will attempt a comparison of the playwrights’ choices and methods of
     presentation.

     A very good to excellent answer may also offer a more detailed analysis and comparison of
     how props are used, considering how they contribute to the dramas as a whole. It will
     evaluate the effectiveness of each playwright’s approach.


2.   An adequate to good answer will identify and compare some uses of dramatic irony and
     comment on their effects.

     A very good to excellent answer may also explore the effect of the instances of dramatic irony
     in greater detail, demonstrating an effective comparison of immediate and broader effects.
     It will evaluate the effectiveness of each playwright’s use of dramatic irony.


3.   An adequate to good answer will deliver an understanding of the question’s requirements to
     address elements such as ideas, characterization or action that have the potential to engage the
     audience in the opening moments. There should be some comparative comment on
     these elements.

     A very good to excellent answer may also go further in exploring the chosen examples by
     comparing their effects. It will also make some evaluation of how powerfully and effectively
     the playwrights have deployed introductory elements.
                                               –4–           N13/1/AXENG/HP2/ENG/TZ0/XX/M


Poetry

4.   An adequate to good answer will identify ways in which some element considered narrative
     helps to convey meaning. The candidate’s approach to narrative can range from observing a
     sequence of events to a more complex representation of character and conflict. It will explore
     the ways in which the “story” is told, possibly discussing the poets’ purpose and the effects on
     the reader. It will offer some comparative comment.

     A very good to excellent answer may also address more precisely the approach identified and
     analyse in some detail the specific effects created. It will offer a more developed comparative
     comment, and some evaluation of the methods employed and their effectiveness.


5.   An adequate to good answer will consider ways in which human qualities are transferred to
     other entities through such means, for example, as personification, comparison, imagery and
     naming. The answer will include examples which can be comparatively discussed.

     A very good to excellent answer may also probe the examples more fully, possibly examining
     patterns and interrelations among the examples. It will make some evaluation of the degree of
     effectiveness achieved.


6.   An adequate to good answer will identify and compare some instances of the poets’ use of
     these types of sounds and comment comparatively on their effects.

     A very good to excellent answer may also offer a more developed comparison of the poets’
     use of sounds and identify, where applicable, patterns of sound within the poems. It will
     evaluate the effective use of sound by each poet addressed.
                                               –5–          N13/1/AXENG/HP2/ENG/TZ0/XX/M


Prose: novel and short story

7.   An adequate to good answer will select and explore important decisions (at least one from
     each work) and compare their roles in the works.

     A very good to excellent answer may also explore more fully both the source and the impact
     of these decisions, considering them comparatively. It will go on to evaluate the relative
     credibility and artistic impact of the chosen decisions.


8.   An adequate to good answer will identify and compare the use of symbols and how they
     enrich at least two of the works addressed.

     A very good to excellent answer may also describe in greater detail the ways in which the
     symbols enrich the works as a whole. It will evaluate each author’s use of symbols and their
     effectiveness.


9.   An adequate to good answer will identify areas where some element or elements of historical
     background and how they contribute to the works. Historical elements can include aspects of
     culture, economics or social mores. Examiners should allow for a broad definition of
     “historical” which may include elements that are contemporary to the authors. There will be
     some comparison of the writers’ methods and effects.

     A very good to excellent answer may also offer a more detailed comparison and more
     perceptive understanding of the significance of this aspect. It will evaluate the ways in which
     each author has incorporated this material in their works and what it has contributed to
     their success.
                                               –6–          N13/1/AXENG/HP2/ENG/TZ0/XX/M


Prose other than fiction

10.   An adequate to good answer will identify not only how the subject matter is described but
      also will consider and compare how the writers convey subjective judgment on the material.

      A very good to excellent answer may also offer more detailed comparison and more
      perceptive comment on the means by which subjective judgment is conveyed. It will evaluate
      the effectiveness of each writer’s methods.


11.   An adequate to good answer will identify some elements that have been emphasized in each
      work. It will offer a comparison of the effects of this emphasis.

      A very good to excellent answer may also explore in greater detail the means and impact of
      the emphasis of these elements. It will include an evaluation of how these elements are given
      significance.


12.   An adequate to good answer will choose features that the candidate finds different or
      unfamiliar in at least two works and compare the ways in which they add an appreciation of
      the works. The candidate should explore what this appreciation entails and how it has been
      created by these elements.

      A very good to excellent answer may also probe more analytically the ways in which interest
      has been heightened by the inclusion of unusual or unfamiliar features. It will evaluate the
      writers’ success in presenting these different or unfamiliar features.
